intro: Restio tremulus, commonly known as the trembling restio, is a perennial grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and tall, flowering spikes. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in coastal and mountainous regions. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Restio tremulus is often found in fynbos vegetation and is adapted to tolerate both wet and dry conditions.
